title: What is the value of a and b if x + 2 is a factor of x2+ax - 2b and a+b=4? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let, f(x) = x + 2 g(x) = x^2+ax - 2b a + b =4 (equation 1) If f(x) is a factor of g(x) it means substitutimg the value of x in g(x) will give us 0. Let's do, x^2 + ax - 2b = 0 (-2)^2 + a × (-2) -2b = 0 4 - 2a +2b = 0 -2a + 2b = -4 2a - 2b = 4 a - b =2( equation 2) Now from equation 1 and equation 2 2a = 6 a = 3 b = 1

A quadratic function has two factors one of which is x+2. Let the other one be x+k Then (x+2)(x+k) = x^2 +ax -2b Consequently, 2+k = a and 2k =-2b Therefore k=-b and 2-b = a We finally get a+b =2 .
